item.title: Boki add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Boki add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "No wonder Van Gogh blasted his head off. Crows and sunlight. Idle zero. Zero eating your guts like an animal inside, letting you shit and fuck and blink your eyes, but nothing, a nothing." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Boki add a quote by Mark Strand
item.description: "Each moment is a place you've never been." -- Mark Strand

item.title: Boki add a quote by Mark Strand
item.description: "When I walk I part the air and always the air moves in to fill the spaces where my body's been." -- Mark Strand

item.title: Boki add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Boki add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Boki add a quote by Bernard Malamud
item.description: "There comes a time in a man's life when to get where he has to go--if there are no doors or windows--he walks through a wall." -- Bernard Malamud

item.title: Boki add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "The end of man is knowledge, but there is one thing he can't know. He can't know whether knowledge will save him or kill him. He will be killed, all right, but he can't know whether he is killed because of the knowledge which he has got or because of the knowledge which he hasn't got and which if he had it, would save him." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Boki add a quote by Robert J. Sawyer
item.description: "Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace." -- Robert J. Sawyer

item.title: Boki add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Life's single lesson: that there is more accident to it than a man can ever admit to in a lifetime and stay sane." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Boki add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Boki add a quote by Peter Shaffer
item.description: "The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you." -- Peter Shaffer

item.title: Boki add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Boki add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Boki add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I can’t write without a reader. It’s precisely like a kiss—you can’t do it alone." -- John Cheever

item.title: Boki add a quote by Amy Sedaris
item.description: "I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone." -- Amy Sedaris

item.title: Boki add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Boki add a quote by Federico García Lorca
item.description: "To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves." -- Federico García Lorca

item.title: Boki add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Boki add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home." -- James Joyce

item.title: Boki add a quote by Philip Barry
item.description: "The time to make up your mind about people, is never." -- Philip Barry

item.title: Boki add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Boki add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Boki add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Boki add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Boki add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "Living is a horizontal fall." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Boki add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Boki add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Boki add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Always try to keep a patch of sky above your life." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Boki add a quote by E. B. White
item.description: "I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savor) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E. B. White
